sections.title: Register Company in Singapore for Foreigner - An Overview
sections.text: Singapore is now the best place to start a business if you want to expand your worldwide reach. Because of its robust yet friendly investment and trade regulations, Singapore is recognised as one of the best countries in the world to do business. Company registration is required for the company's owners. New company registration in Singapore is simple and inexpensive.

Singapore is placed second in the Ease of Doing Business Report 2020, which serves as a benchmark for foreigners and locals interested in forming a company in Singapore. According to Singaporean legislation, foreign corporate entities or foreign individuals are not permitted to register as a business in Singapore. For New company registration in Singapore, they must use a local expert business.

sections.text: The following is a basic rundown of the many forms of business entities in singapore company formation:

sections.title: Private Limited Company Formation in Singapore
sections.text: A private limited company in Singapore has a different legal position from its owners and directors, who have limited accountability for the business's debts and losses. The owner of this business entity has the right to own property.

sections.heading: Minimum Setup Requirements:

sections.title: Limited Liability Partnership Registration in Singapore
sections.text: A limited liability partnership combines the benefits of a private limited company and a partnership to provide you the maximum freedom while keeping your legal entity independent from your partners.

sections.heading: Minimum Setup Requirements:
sections.items: A minimum of two partners is required | A full-time resident manager | A registered address

sections.title: Setting up Subsidiary Company in Singapore
sections.text: A subsidiary company is a private limited company that is owned by an external business entity. This external corporate entity may possess 10% of the company. Setting up company in Singapore enjoys the same benefits as a Singapore-based private limited company.
To Register your business in Singapore you can either apply for a Singapore work permit and relocate to Singapore, or you can appoint a nominee director and administer your business from outside.

sections.title: Company's Branch Office Formation in Singapore
sections.text: A branch office is a non-Singapore-based growth of a foreign corporate entity. Because it is a non-resident, it is not eligible for tax exemptions like other Singapore private limited companies. To Register your business in Singapore you must apply for a Singapore company incorporation employment pass if your company desires to move or send staff to Singapore to conduct business.

sections.heading: Minimum Setup Requirements:

sections.title: Business Representative Office in Singapore
sections.text: A representative office is a temporary structure that cannot last for more than three years. Setting up company in Singapore permits foreign corporations to temporarily move to Singapore to explore and interact with local distributors as well as analyse the market. To relocate, you'll need a Singapore incorporation employment pass.

items.question: Can we use an Indian license in Singapore?
items.answer: Yes, you can use an Indian driving license in Singapore, but only for a short period. If you plan to drive in Singapore for more than a year, you need to convert your Indian license to a Singapore driving license.

items.question: Do Indians need a work permit in Singapore?
items.answer: Yes, Indians who want to work in Singapore need a work permit or employment pass. The type of permit you need depends on the job and your qualifications.

items.question: How long does it take to get a license for doing business in Singapore?
items.answer: The time to get a business license in Singapore can vary. Generally, it takes about 1-2 weeks. But it can take longer if extra checks are needed.

items.question: How much is the income tax rate in Singapore?
items.answer:
• Residents are eligible for a number of personal exemptions and are subject to progressive tax rates ranging from 0% to 22% (24% as of the year of assessment 2024)
  • Individuals who are non-residents are not eligible for any personal exemptions and must pay tax at a fixed rate of 22% (24% starting in the year of assessment 2024)
  • Non-residents are given a break by having their employment income taxed at the highest of a flat rate of 15% or the graduated resident rates with personal exemptions. Directors who are not residents are not eligible for this exception.

items.question: Can an Indian company open a branch office in Singapore?
items.answer: Yes, an Indian company can open a branch office in Singapore, subject to compliance with the regulations and requirements of the Singapore government. The company must register with the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA) and obtain necessary permits and licences to operate in Singapore.

items.question: How many Indian companies are in Singapore?
items.answer: A number of Indian start-ups, like Flipkart, have established holding companies in Singapore to take advantage of more funding options.

items.question: What is the double tax agreement between India and Singapore?
items.answer: The Double Tax Avoidance Agreement (DTAA) between Singapore and India prevents Singapore and India from taxing citizens of both countries twice on their income.

items.question: Who can incorporate a company in Singapore?
items.answer: A Singaporean, Singapore Permanent Resident, or a Singapore Employment Pass holder can register a Singapore company. If a foreigner wishes to set up a company incorporation singapore, they will require a resident director who has one of the above residential statuses in Singapore.

items.question: How long does it take to incorporate a company in Singapore?
items.answer: It takes one day to set up a company in Singapore with ACRA.

items.question: Can a foreigner be a shareholder in a company?
items.answer: Yes, a foreigner can be a shareholder in a company. Although, the company must have a Singapore resident director.
